stories.text:
Many websites now have a fixed div at the top or bottom of the page. The "spacebar to scroll a page" feature of most browsers is broken on these pages. It uses a naive method of scrolling the window height, when it should be scrolling the height of the frame which is scrollable.

Do any browsers do this properly, or are they all broken?

Example website with fixed divs that scrolls too far using spacebar:

https://www.theatlantic.com/magazine/archive/2022/05/social-media-democracy-trust-babel/629369/
stories.title: Ask HN: Can any browsers scroll a page of text properly using the spacebar?
Finland Returns $46 M. In Detained Artwork to Russia, France Continues to Hold
Neptune's stratosphere temperature falls 8C over 17 years

stories.text:
I have around 10+exp. Recently, I have been trying for job change and most companies are asking Linked List questions in the interviews instead of the role/expertise/something needed for the project. So, I get rejection mails from some roles which we really liked.

Usually, when we take interviews to our team, we focus mostly on arrays/hashmaps/strings, etc as we encounter them in all the work.

Not sure why these companies still want to use Linked List even for senior interviews.
stories.title: Asking Linked List questions for senior interviews?
